ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name

Notes: 1= 0 seconds; 2= 1-59 seconds; 3= 1-15 minutes; 4= 16-60 minutes; 5= Less than one day; 6= 1-2 days; 7= 3-6 days; 8= 1-2 weeks; 9= 2+ weeks; 10= Wide range (spans > 2 responses)

ElementDescription: Thinking about all of the times that you have had thoughts like this, on  average, how strong was the urge to kill yourself on a scale of 0-4?
Notes: 0 = Not At All; 1 = A Little Bit; 2 = Somewhat; 3 = Very Much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Thinking about all of the times that you/your child have had thoughts like this, on average, how intense were these thoughts on a scale of 0-4?
Have you ever experienced any of the following images in your mind? Your accidental death

How many days in the past month? Made or thought about suicide plan. PX640501_Suicide_Plan_Days_Past_Month
How many separate times in the past six months (have you made a plan to kill yourself)?
On the scale of 0 to 4, at the worst point, how seriously did you/your child consider acting on the plan? PX640501_Suicide_Plan_Seriousness_Worst_Point
On average, how long did you/your child usually think about your suicide plan(s) before either moving onto something else or acting on the plan(s)?
Notes: 1 = 0 seconds; 2 = 1-59 seconds; 3 = 1-15 minutes; 4 = 16-60 minutes; 5 = Less than one day; 6 = 1-2 days; 7 = 3-6 days; 8 = 1-2 weeks; 9 = 2 or more weeks; 10 = Wide range (spans greater than 2 responses)

ElementDescription: Have you ever been very close to killing yourself and at the last minute, you decided not to before you took any action? (e.g., held a bottle of pills in your hand but decided not to take any, set up a noose but decided not to use it, pointed a gun to your head)?
What happened? (aborted attempts)
How many times in the past year? (aborted attempts)
How many times in your life? (aborted attempts)

Have you ever been very close to killing yourself and at the last minute, someone or something else stopped you before you took any action? (e.g., held a bottle of pills in your hand, but then someone walked in and stopped you before you took any pills, pointed a gun to your head but then someone came in and stopped you.)?
What happened? (interrupted attempt)
How many times in the past year? (interrupted attempts)
How many times in your life have you been very close to killing yourself and at the last minute, someone or something else stopped you before you took any action?
Have you ever made an actual attempt to kill yourself in which you had at least some intent to die? PX640501_Suicide_Attempt_Ever
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 999 = N/A or Prefer Not to Answer

Notes: 0= 0 seconds; 1= 1-59 seconds; 2= 1-15 minutes; 3= 16-60 minutes; 4= Less than one day; 5= 1-2 days; 6= 3-6 days; 7= 1-2 weeks; 8= 2+ weeks; 9= Wide range (spans > 2 responses)
